content.text: Summarize the following call transcript:  Customer Service Agent: "Thank you for contacting Amazon Customer Service. My name is Sarah. How may I assist you today?" Customer: "Hi Sarah, I received a coffee maker I ordered last week, but it's not working properly. I'd like to return it." Customer Service Agent: "I'm sorry to hear about the issue with your coffee maker. I'll be happy to help you with the return process. Could you please provide your order number?" Customer: "Yes, it's #ABC123456." Customer Service Agent: "Thank you. I can see that you ordered the Premium Coffee Maker on April 3rd. Could you tell me what specific issues you're experiencing with the product?" Customer: "When I try to brew coffee, it makes a loud noise and only produces half a cup, even when filled with the correct amount of water." Customer Service Agent: "I understand how frustrating that must be. Since the product is defective, I'll process a free return for you. You won't have to pay any shipping costs. Would you like a refund or a replacement?" Customer: "I'd prefer a refund, please." Customer Service Agent: "I'll process that right away. I'm generating a return label that will be sent to your email within the next 10 minutes. Once you receive it, simply pack the coffee maker in a secure box, attach the label, and drop it off at any UPS location. Once we receive the return, your refund will be processed within 2-3 business days." Customer: "That sounds good. How long do I have to send it back?" Customer Service Agent: "You have 30 days to return the item using the provided label. Is there anything else I can help you with today?" Customer: "No, that's all. Thanks for your help, Sarah." Customer Service Agent: "You're welcome! Thank you for contacting Amazon Customer Service. Have a great day!"
